doc.ContractDescription: DISSOCIATIVE RECOMBINATION (DR), IN WHICH A MOLECULAR ION CAPTURES AN ELECTRON AND SEPARATES INTO FRAGMENTS, PLAYS A CENTRAL ROLE IN DETERMINING THE TEMPERATURE, ESCAPE RATES, ELECTRON DENSITIES, RADIATIVE CHARACTERISTICS, AND CHEMISTRY OF THE IONOSPHERES OF PLANETS, MOONS, AND COMETS. DR RATE COEFFICIENTS HAVE BEEN ESSENTIAL FOR THE INTERPRETATION OF DATA RETURNED BY MANY NASA MISSIONS OVER THE COURSE OF NEARLY 38 YEARS (PIONEER 10 AND 11, VOYAGER 1 AND 2, GALILEO, CASSINI SATURN ORBITER, NEW HORIZONS PLUTO CHARON, SOHO) AND FUTURE MISSIONS.

doc.ContractDescription: HERE WE PROPOSE A NEW INVESTIGATION TO ACCOMPLISH THE MONITORING AND CONTROL OF THE MIRRORS BY MONITORING THE HEALTH OF THE PIEZOELECTRIC ACTUATORS OF THE ADJUSTABLE OPTICS TO A LEVEL CONSISTENT WITH 0.5 ARCSEC IMAGING. SUCH MEASUREMENTS ARE BEYOND THE CAPABILITY OF CONVENTIONAL, THIN METAL FILM STAIN GAUGES USING DC MEASUREMENTS. INSTEAD, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP THE TECHNOLOGY TO DEPOSIT DIFFERENT TYPES OF STRAIN GAUGES (METAL FILM, SEMICONDUCTOR) DIRECTLY ON THE PIEZOELECTRIC CELLS; TO INVESTIGATE THE USE OF ADDITIONAL THIN LAYERS OF PIEZOELECTRIC MATERIALS SUCH AS LEAD ZIRCONATE TITANATE OR ZINC OXIDE AS STRAIN AND TEMPERATURE GAUGES; AND TO USE AC MEASUREMENT OF STRAIN GAUGES FOR PRECISE MEASUREMENT OF PIEZOELECTRIC ADJUSTER PERFORMANCE. THE INTENT IS TO USE THIS INFORMATION TO CORRECT CHANGES IN MIRROR SHAPE BY ADJUSTING THE VOLTAGES ON THE PIEZOELECTRIC ADJUSTORS.

doc.ContractDescription: THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE TO MAKE HIGH QUALITY MARS DAILY GLOBAL MAPS (MDGMS) USING PUBLICALLY RELEASED MARS RECONNAISSANCE ORBITER (MRO) MARS COLOR IMAGER (MARCI) RAW IMAGES, AND TO ARCHIVE THE PRODUCT IN THE PLANETARY DATA SYSTEM (PDS) IMAGING NODE. THE MRO MARCI MDGMS EXTEND THE NEARLY CONTINUOUS DAILY GLOBAL MAPPING OF MARS ESTABLISHED SINCE THE MARS GLOBAL SURVEYOR (MGS) MARS ORBITER CAMERA (MOC) MDGMS. TOGETHER, THEY FORM A UNIQUE DATA SET WHICH WILL BE THE BASE FOR NUMEROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND APPLICATIONS. MDGMS ARE HIGHLY USEFUL FOR STUDYING TIME VARIABLE PHENOMENA ON MARS, SUCH AS CHANGES IN THE SURFACE ALBEDO, POLAR CAPS, CLOUDS AND DUST STORMS. BETTER KNOWLEDGE OF THESE PHENOMENA WILL GREATLY IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF MARS, AND PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION FOR FUTURE MARS MISSIONS. THE RAW MRO MARCI IMAGES ARE DIFFICULT TO USE DIRECTLY. WE PROCESS THESE IMAGES INTO MDGMS THAT ARE MUCH MORE USER FRIENDLY AND DISSEMINATE THE PRODUCT THROUGH THE PDS TO THE PUBLIC. THIS PROPOSAL IS RELEVANT TO PDART BECAUSE IT ADDRESSES PDART'S OBJECTIVE OF "INCREASE THE AMOUNT AND QUALITY OF DIGITAL INFORMATION AND DATA PRODUCTS AVAILABLE FOR PLANETARY SCIENCE RESEARCH AND EXPLORATION".
doc.MajorAgency: MARS DAILY GLOBAL MAPS FOR MARS RECONNAISSANCE ORB
doc.MajorFundingAgency: MARS DAILY GLOBAL MAPS FOR MARS RECONNAISSANCE ORB

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE A COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN MIT AND THE NASA GODDARD INSTITUTE FOR SPACE SCIENCE (GISS) IN NEW YORK. THE PROGRAM BRINGS TOGETHER THE EXPERTISE OF MIT IN OCEAN DYNAMICS AND OCEAN MODELING WITH THAT OF GISS IN COUPLED CLIMATE MODELING. THE RESEARCH IS DIRECTED AT (I) COORDINATING OCEAN MODELING ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE CURRENT OCEAN MODELS BEING DEVELOPED AT GISS AND (II) APPLYING THEM IN THE GISS COUPLED MODELING FRAMEWORK TO LEARN ABOUT HOW FEEDBACKS BETWEEN THE ATMOSPHERE AND OCEAN AFFECT NATURAL VARIABILITY AND SHAPE THE RESPONSE OF THE CLIMATE SYSTEM TO ANTHROPOGENIC FORCING. IN PARTICULAR THE MIT-GISS COLLABORATION WILL FOCUS ON: 1. IMPROVING THE DYNAMICAL KERNEL OF THE GISS OCEAN MODEL SO THAT IT CAN BE USED ACROSS SCALE (INCLUDING EDDY-RESOLVING) WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON POLAR PROCESSES AND THE INTERACTION OF OCEAN AND ICE. 2. USING THE RESULTING MODELS TO EXPLORE THE ROBUSTNESS OF THE RESPONSE OF THE COUPLED SYSTEM TO TRANSIENT (I.E. DECADAL TO CENTENNIAL) GREENHOUSE GAS AND OZONE CLIMATE FORCING, WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON THE POLAR CAPS. THE GISS MODEL-E DEPLOYED IN STUDIES OF CLIMATE CHANGE WILL PROVIDE THE MODELING CONTEXT BUT, WHERE APPROPRIATE, MODELS DEVELOPED AT MIT WILL ALSO BE USED.
doc.MajorAgency: RESEARCH THE NATURAL VARIABILITY OF CLIMATE AND TH
doc.MajorFundingAgency: RESEARCH THE NATURAL VARIABILITY OF CLIMATE AND TH

FPDS BASE DESCRIPTION, MULTIPLE YEAR AWARD AND INCREMENTAL FUNDING FOR YEARS 1 OF 5. THIS PROPOSAL IS ENTITLED, "FOUNDATIONS OF COMPLEX LIFE: EVOLUTION, PRESERVATION AND DETECTION ON EARTH AND BEYOND." THIS IS AWARDED IN RESPONSE TO COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT NOTICE (CAN) NO. NNH12ZDA002C, (NAI), CYCLE SIX. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR IS ROGER E. SUMMONS WITH MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (MIT). BASIC COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SPECIAL CONDITION COLLABORATION STATEMENT: 1260.51 COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SPECIAL CONDITION. (OCTOBER 2000) (A) THIS AWARD IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AS IT IS ANTICIPATED THERE WILL BE SUBSTANTIAL NASA INVOLVEMENT DURING PERFORMANCE OF THE EFFORT. NASA AND THE RECIPIENT MUTUALLY AGREE TO THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT OF ANTICIPATED COOPERATIVE INTERACTIONS WHICH MAY OCCUR DURING THE PERFORMANCE OF THIS EFFORT: THE NASA ASTROBIOLOGY INSTITUTE (NAI) DIRECTOR AND NAI CENTRAL ARE HOUSED AT NASA AMES RESEARCH CENTER, NASA'S LEAD CENTER FOR ASTROBIOLOGY. NAI CENTRAL IS RESPONSIBLE FOR COORDINATING INSTITUTE ACTIVITIES, ADVOCATING THE NEEDS AND SCIENTIFIC INTERESTS OF THE MEMBERS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, DISBURSING FUNDS (INCLUDING A STRATEGIC DIRECTOR'S DISCRETIONARY FUND (DDF) FOR HIGH-RISK/HIGH-PAYOFF RESEARCH PROJECTS AND FOR FOSTERING COLLABORATION BETWEEN MEMBERS), SPONSORING THE NAI POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM, COLLECTING AND ARCHIVING INFORMATION ON RESEARCH ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND PUBLICATIONS, ORGANIZING FOCUS GROUP MEETINGS AND WORKSHOPS, AND EXPEDITING NETWORK CONNECTIVITY WHILE ENGINEERING THE INTERFACES BETWEEN THE SCIENTISTS AND THE NETWORK. NAI CENTRAL IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR ORGANIZING GENERAL MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, AND STRATEGIC RETREATS TO ENGAGE MEMBERS OF THE INSTITUTE IN INTEGRATED RESEARCH. NAI CENTRAL WILL, IN ADDITION, COORDINATE INSTITUTE-WIDE ACTIVITIES, IN EDUCATION AND PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND IN THE TRAINING OF STUDENTS AND OTHER YOUNG INVESTIGATORS. MEMBERS OF THE NIA/MIT TEAM, THROUGH THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, WILL: ACTIVELY PURSUE ITS RESEARCH PROGRAM; PARTICIPATE IN INSTITUTE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WORKSHOPS, SEMINARS, FOCUS GROUPS, CLASSES, TRAINING, AND EDUCATION AND PUBLIC OUTREACH; CONTRIBUTE TO NASA SCIENCE WORKING GROUPS AND ANALYSIS COMMITTEES; AND WORK CONTINUOUSLY TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE INTER-MEMBER CONNECTIONS AND COLLABORATIONS. THE PI OF LEAD TEAM, AS A MEMBER OF THE NIA EXECUTIVE COUNCIL, WILL MEET BY VIDEO-CON ON A MONTHLY BASIS IN PERSON THREE OR FOUR TIMES ANNUALLY. THE PI WILL PARTICIPATE VIA THE EXECUTIVE COUNCIL AS THE PRIMARY TECHNICAL GUIDING BODY OF THE INSTITUTE. LEAD INSTITUTION SITES WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH NASA DEPLOYED VIDEOCONFERENCING SYSTEMS THAT ENABLE TEAM PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS TO ATTEND MONTHLY EXECUTIVE COUNCIL MEETINGS AND TO CONFER WITH ONE ANOTHER, WITH NAI MANAGEMENT AT AMES, AND WITH NASA HQ PERSONNEL. THESES CONFERENCING SYSTEMS ARE ALSO TO BE UTILIZED FOR A VARIETY OF OTHER PURPOSES BY NAI MEMBERS LOCATED AT THE LEAD INSTITUTIONS, INCLUDING JOINT PRESENTATIONS OF CLASSES, SEMINARS, AND SCIENTIFIC EXCHANGE. PROJECT SUMMARY: WE WILL COMBINE OUR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH WITH A ROBUST PROGRAM OF EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND OUTREACH TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC THAT WILL INCLUDE AFTER-SCHOOL SCIENCE CURRICULA, DEVELOPMENT OF UNDERGRADUATE RESOURCES, PARTICIPATION IN LOCAL AND DISTRICT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS THE CAMBRIDGE SCIENCE FESTIVAL, OUTREACH TRAINING FOR TEAM MEMBERS, AND CONTINUED INVOLVEMENT WITH OTHER NAI TEAMS IN CONDUCTING WORKSHOPS WITHOUT WALLS AND IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF VIRTUAL FIELD TRIPS.
